acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=2.2ppm of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on rabbit LD50 = 850mg/kg (ACGIH (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 4 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50;VALUE:940 mg/kg;  REFERENCE SOURCE: ACGIH (2001)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the category by ACGIH being A4, it carried out the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=3.41(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available. Melting point: >55degC

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine) and the chlorine is chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Since it was possible to judge that there was no spontaneous combustibility because the ignition point (> 93 degC ) was measured (PM (13th, 2003)), it was defined as "out of Category".

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since although there was a description that dysgenesis in neonatal's head and faceof rabbit (RTECS (2004)), there was no statements about content and about levels of abnormalities and there was no data in others, it presupposed that it cannot classify since data is insufficient.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There was a statement of the purport that there is a possibility of doing a stimulus and a disorder to an eye by contact by humans (HSFS (2000), SITTIG (4th, 2002)), and since there was no description that how degrees, it was set as Category 2A-2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 based on the statement that it has a possibility of causing irritation and disorder to the skin on contact (SITTIG (4th, 2002)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to as Category 2 (liver, kidney) based on the statement that there is a possibility of doing a damage to liver and the kidney in human as effects of long term or repeated exposure (SITTIG (4th, 2002)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Narcotic effects, Respiratory tract irritation
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is the description that there is a possibility that high concentration dusts may cause dizziness and unconsciousness in humans (SITTIG (4th, 2002)), there is the description that a nose and a throat are stimulated in humans (HSFS (2000), SITTIG (4th, 2002)), and it is classified into Category 3 (anesthetic actions, respiratory irritation) .
